Unknown.translation: Just as a tree bears fruit at a certain time of the year, but there are some trees which bear fruit all the time (like Kalap Variksh) and their fruit is very tasty too.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ iek ibrC qwˆ smwˆ pw ky Kws Kws ru`q isr PilAw krdy hn Aqy iek sdIvkwl bwrwˆ mwsIey hI PilAw krdy hn; qy Enwˆ dy Pl BI sdw im`Ty sÍwd vwly huMdy hn[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kUp jl inksq hY jqn kIey; gMgw jl mukiq pRvwh pRswid hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as drawing water from the well demands some effort, but the flow of water in river Ganges is continuous and in plenty.

lines.gurmukhi: imRqkw Agin qUl qyl myl dIp idpY; jgmg joiq ssIAr ibsmwd hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as the combination of an earthen lamp, oil, cotton and fire results in a light-giving lamp that spreads its radiance in a limited place, but the radiance of the moon shines in the whole world and spreads strange happiness all around.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: imtI dIvy dI TUTI; A`g; rUeIˆ Aqy qyl dy imlÎwˆ dIvw bilAw krdw hY; pr ssIAr cMd dI joq inrjqn hI jgmg jgmg pRkwS krdI ibsmwd AwnMd idAwˆ krdI hY[

Unknown.translation: Similarly, whatever quantum of devoted service one performs for a god, one receives reward accordingly. But a vision of the True teacher dispels the fear of angels of death beside blessing I one with many other goods. (All gods grant goods to their follow
